Electric vehicles.Description: Electric vehicles use batteries as their primary source of power.
Electric vehicles require charging stations to recharge their batteries.
The limited range of electric vehicles can cause range anxiety among drivers.
Electric vehicles are powered by electric motors instead of internal combustion engines.
Plug-in hybrids are a type of electric vehicle that combines an internal combustion engine with an electric motor and battery.
Electric vehicles utilize regenerative braking technology to convert kinetic energy into electric energy and recharge the battery.
The widespread adoption of electric vehicles relies on the development of a robust electric vehicle charging network.
Electric vehicles commonly employ lithium-ion batteries due to their high energy density and long lifespan.
Electric vehicles are manufactured by companies specializing in the production of electric vehicles.
The use of electric vehicles helps reduce carbon emissions and mitigate climate change.
